name: Unite
description: Built on Base, Unite is a Layer 3 blockchain solution purpose-built for mobile games, combining ultra-low gas fees, high throughput, and robust security to empower developers and onboard the next billion gamers into Web3. Unite Blockchain Unite addresses the core adoption challenges facing Web3 gaming and unlocks new value across key stakeholder groups: Game Developers: Unite removes the regulatory ambiguity and technical complexity typically associated with integrating blockchain into mobile apps. By adhering to the compliance standards of Apple’s App Store and Google Play, Unite ensures that developers can safely and confidently publish Web3-enabled games. The Unite SDK is designed for ease of use and compatibility with the most popular engines—including Unity, Cocos, and HTML5—allowing rapid integration of tokenized rewards, player-owned assets, and decentralized economies. Developers can leverage the $UNITE token to create engaging, interoperable, and monetizable game layers while minimizing time-to-market and regulatory risk. Gamers: For gamers, Unite eliminates the barriers to Web3 participation—no prior blockchain knowledge and no gas fees incurred. Through a seamless partnership with the RLY Network Association, Unite offers gasless transactions and intuitive wallet interfaces. Players can earn, use, and trade $UNITE tokens directly within their favorite games, without ever touching a seed phrase or external wallet interface. This dramatically lowers the onboarding friction, making Web3 gaming accessible to mainstream mobile audiences who value simplicity and security. Crypto Traders: The $UNITE token offers direct exposure to one of the most promising segments in crypto: mobile gaming. With traditional mobile gaming generating over $300 billion annually, Unite positions itself at the forefront of this explosive sector by introducing scalable, tokenized economies into mass-market games. As adoption of Web3 mobile games accelerates, so does the demand for $UNITE—creating a compelling trading narrative powered by real utility, developer growth, and network effects.
